Greetings to All:
 
 The Apostle Paul writes to us Gentiles (Rom. 11:13), saying, "For just as we have many members in one body and all the members do not have the same function, so we, who are many, are one body in Christ, and individually members one of another." Rom. 12:4+5. And again, "Now you are Christ's body, and individually members of it." 1Cor. 12:27. While I can provide you with numerous verses like, "because we are members of His body" (Eph. 5:30), I cannot give you one verse where Paul says we are the 'bride of Christ.' Paul simply never uses the word even once in his Gentile Epistles. NASB.
 
 Israel of the flesh, however, is identified through prophecy (OT) and the fulfillment of prophecy (NT; Hebrew Epistles) as the 'bride.' First we are to recognize the Lord God (YHVH Elohim; Gen. 2:4, etc.) as the 'Lord of the Sabbath,' (Matt. 12:8), as the Lord of this seventh day period, i.e., as our Lord Jesus Christ. He says, "I will betroth you [Israel] to Me forever; Yes, I will betroth you to Me in righteousness and in justice, In lovingkindness and in compassion, and I will betroth you to Me in faithfulness. Then you will know the LORD." Hosea 2:19+20.
 
 Jesus Christ came along after John the Baptist who appeared from the wilderness to Israel of the flesh (Matt. 3:3). Note carefully the wording of the OT Text. "A voice is calling, "Clear the way for the LORD in the wilderness; Make smooth in the desert a highway for our God." Isaiah 40:3. You and I know that Jesus Christ is the Lord who followed this messenger, and the OT prophecy verifies that this Person was the Lord God Himself. The same is true for Malachi 3:1-3. 
 
 In the New Testament (outside of Paul's Epistles), we have several examples where Christ and others describe Him as this bridegroom seeking His bride. "And Jesus said to them, "The attendants of the bridegroom cannot mourn as long as the bridegroom is with them, can they? But the days will come when the bridegroom is taken away from them, and then they will fast." Matt. 9:15. "And Jesus said to them, "While the bridegroom is with them, the attendants of the bridegroom cannot fast, can they? So long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast." Mark 2:18-20 (19), See also Luke 5:34+35.
 
 John the Baptist bears witness, "He who has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom's voice. So this joy of mine has been made full." John 3:29.
 
 The Book of Revelation describes the future marriage of the bride to the Lamb, "Let us rejoice and be glad and give the glory to Him, for the marriage of the Lamb has come and His bride has made herself ready." Rev. 19:7. Then later on, this bride is called his wife. "Then one of the seven angels who had the seven bowls full of the seven last plagues came and spoke with me, saying, "Come here, I will show you the bride, the wife of the Lamb." Rev. 21:9. Then, in unison, "The Spirit and the bride say, "Come." And let the one who hears say, "Come." And let the one who is thirsty come; let the one who wishes take the water of life without cost." Rev. 22:17.
 
 Many professing Christians today wish to distort these things and make us (the Gentile Body of Christ) into the 'bride of Christ,' instead of His body. Some among them believe, since Israel rejected Christ and demanded His crucifixion (Matt. 27:23), that God's promises to Israel, as His Chosen Race, have been given to the Gentiles. What does Paul say? 
 
 "For I do not want you, brethren, to be uninformed of this mystery--so that you will not be wise in your own estimation--that a partial hardening has happened to Israel until the fullness of the Gentiles has come in; and so all Israel will be saved; just as it is written, "THE DELIVERER WILL COME FROM ZION, HE WILL REMOVE UNGODLINESS FROM JACOB. THIS IS MY COVENANT WITH THEM, WHEN I TAKE AWAY THEIR SINS." Romans 11:25-27.
 
 Peter, James, the writer of Acts and the Prophets are in full agreement with Paul, that a period will pass, then all Israel will be saved. James said at the meeting in Jerusalem (OT Text in Caps), "Simeon has related how God first concerned Himself about taking from among the Gentiles a people for His name [the body of Christ; that's us]. With this the words of the Prophets agree, just as it is written, 'AFTER THESE THINGS I will return, AND I WILL REBUILD THE TABERNACLE OF DAVID WHICH HAS FALLEN, AND I WILL REBUILD ITS RUINS, AND I WILL RESTORE IT, SO THAT THE REST OF MANKIND MAY SEEK THE LORD, AND ALL THE GENTILES WHO ARE CALLED BY MY NAME,' SAYS THE LORD, WHO MAKES THESE THINGS KNOWN FROM LONG AGO." Acts 15:14-18.
 
 While the OT Prophets saw the bride of Christ (Israel joined in marriage to the Lord God; Rev. 19:5-10), they did not see that the Lord God would have a 'body of Christ' prepared beforehand. Our gospel is according to the revelation of the mystery (Rom. 16:25) which was not seen by any of the prophets. Our Lord Jesus Christ is called the "Lamb" in regards to His bride, because the ceremony includes all the members who have been baptized into His body (that's us 'in' Christ; 1Cor. 12:12-14) on the cross (Rom. 6:3+4) at Calvary. 
 
 While Israel's joining to Christ is future and governed by the legal aspects of marriage, we are members of the Lamb already, being baptized into His body and seated in the heavenly placed 'in' Christ. Eph. 2:4-7 (6). Those who believed the 'gospel of the kingdom' (Matt. 4:17 (23), 9:35, 24:14, Acts 8:12) are waiting in anticipation of the marriage supper of the Lamb to be joined with Him. Those who have believed Paul's gospel (Rom. 2:16, 16:25; describing 1Cor. 15:1-4) are members of His body already.
 
 God bless,
 
 Terral

 Verse in question: 2 Cor 11:2 For I am jealous for you with a godly jealousy; for I [betrothed] you to one [husband], so that to Christ I might present you {as} a pure virgin. 
 
 Requested changes: [betrothed] to (joined), [husband] to (man).
 
 Here is the problem, and the source of many errant definitions and interpretations in this area. This word betrothed (harmozo, #718) is derived from (harmos, #719), which means "a joining; joint." Holman's Exhaustive Concordance. Both of these words are also used only one time in Scripture (harmozo in 2Cor. 11:2, and harmos in Heb. 4:12). The root of which is "harma" which is literally "a chariot." The meaning of all these words is tied to the traditional meaning and action of joining a chariot to one or more horses. The regular Greek word for "betrothal" (like " . . . Mary had been betrothed to Joseph" Matt. 1:18) is mnesteus (#3423). 
 
 When you boil all of this information down, it becomes painfully obvious that this word 'betrothed' in 2Cor. 11:2 has been translated incorrectly by the Lockman Foundation scholars, and most everyone else. To make matters worse, they used this preconceived notion to defile the translation of another key word in the verse. Let us look at it again, "For I am jealous for you with a godly jealousy; for I betrothed you to one [Husband], so that to Christ I might present you {as} a pure virgin." 2Cor. 11:2. This word husband is (aner, #435), which is the primary NT word for 'man.' This word is translated over 150 times in your Bible as a form of 'man.' Aner can be translated 'husband' IF the context warrants. The translators used 'betrothed' to alter 'man' into 'husband.'
 
 Many people have the errant idea that we are the 'bride of Christ,' because of the wording of this one passage of Scripture. Paul is not saying that we are a bride betrothed to one husband. Paul is saying, ""For I am jealous for you with a godly jealousy; for I joined you to one Man, so that to Christ I might present you {as} a pure virgin." 2Cor. 11:2. 
 
 We are the members of the body of Christ (Rom. 12:4+5, 1Cor. 12:12-14), "For the husband is the head of the wife, as Christ also is the head of the church, He Himself {being} the Savior of the body.  Paul is saying "joined," because our participation in the gospel and our joining to Him is in the past. Saying that we are 'betrothed' infers that our joining to Christ is future. These recommended changes work to restore the continuity of Paul's teaching pertaining to the body of Christ being joined to the Head to form the New Man.  Maximus << The fulfillment of Israel's matrimony to Christ as the bride is in the Church's matrimony to Christ as the bride--with Jew and Gentile as members with no distinction between them. The Church is the Body of Christ and it is the Bride of Christ

The remaining Kingdom letters represent the personal mail to the members of the bride of Christ living through the coming 1000 year Kingdom Dispensation.  We have thousands of denominations of Christianity in the world today, because so many have taken the marching orders of God to both groups and have mixed them all together to create their own form of false doctrine. Rom. 2:14-16.
 
 The body of Christ is being fashioned according to Paul's gospel, which is according to the revelation of the mystery. Rom. 16:25. Are you ready for your secrets to be judged according to Paul's gospel? Or the gospel of the kingdom? I can assure all of you who hold the 'one gospel' view do not know the difference, and are perishing. 2Cor. 4:3+4, 2Pet. 3:14-16. 
 
 God bless,
 
 Terral

 Rev 19:7 "Let us rejoice and be glad and give the glory to Him, for the marriage of the Lamb has come and His bride has made herself ready. It was given to her to clothe herself in fine linen, bright {and} clean; for the fine linen is the righteous acts of the saints. Then he *said to me, "Write, 'Blessed are those who are invited to the marriage supper of the Lamb.'" And he *said to me, "These are true words of God." Then I fell at his feet to worship him. But he *said to me, "Do not do that; I am a fellow servant of yours and your brethren who hold the testimony of Jesus; worship God. For the testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy." Rev. 19:7-10.
 
 Ahhh, the spirit of prophecy. The 'gospel of the kingdom' is indeed according to Prophecy. Isa. 40:3, Mal. 3:1, etc.. Christ is here called the Lamb (Rev. 19), because that includes all the members of the body of Christ, who are already present within Him. We became members of the body of the Lamb, by being established in Him through Paul's gospel, which is according to the revelation of the mystery (Rom. 16:25). Our one baptism (Eph. 4:5) was performed by the Holy Spirit (1Cor. 12:13) the moment we believed, and our life is hidden with Christ in God already. Col. 3:1-4 (3). 
 
 Are you joined to Christ already, by being baptized into His body according to Paul's gospel, or are you waiting for the events of Revelation 19:5-10 to be joined to the Lamb? It appears to me that you are indeed waiting for some future event to be joined to Christ through a marriage ritual. After all, if you were already a member of His body, then there is no way you could possibly be teaching our participation in a future marriage to Him. You are waiting for things promised to Israel of the flesh, while those obedient to Paul's gospel are 'in Him' already. Then, when they finally attain to their marriage ritual, your time to accept Paul's gospel will be past. The power of the deluding influence (2Thes. 2:10) is certainly very powerful indeed. 
 
 In Christ,
 
 Terral

Peace Terral.
 
 Keep studying the Word. Keep following Christ.
